@trakmastatom Toxic masculinity being the cultural norm has had damaging repercussions for both men and women alike. Men (in general) experience higher rates of substance abuse and suicide, in part because we don’t allow our boys to process their emotions in truly healthy ways. The documentary “The Mask We Wear” does a really good job of illustrating the damaging effects of machismo culture. I agree, allowing our boys to be more sensitive can only have positive outcomes. ❤️

I find the argument that this kind of thing is bad for men puzzling. It might be bad for some men (the type that like to harass and be violent, etc.) but it is a very good thing for so many other men like me, who have been made to feel bad for so long for being more sensitive and having my masculinity questioned for not being a shitty stereotype. Not only is this attitude good for women and feminism, it is also good for so so many men like myself and others. Just not good for the shitty ones. Which is also a good thing.
